question:
While determining the coefficient of viscosity of the given liquid, a spherical steel ball sinks by a distance <katex>$h = 0.9$</katex> m. The radius of the ball <katex>$r = \sqrt{3} \times 10^{-3}$</katex> m. The time taken by the ball to sink in three trails are tabulated as follows.

| Trial No. | Time taken by the ball to fall by h (in second) |
|---|---|
| 1 | 2.75 |
| 2 | 2.65 |
| 3 | 2.70 |

The difference between the densities of the steel ball and the liquid is <katex>$7000~kg~m^{-3}$</katex>. If <katex>$g = 10ms^{-2}$</katex>, then the coefficient of viscosity of the given liquid at room temperature is
